item.title: Report E-2025050411
item.description:
Report E-2025050411

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking plastic jerrican containing hazardous product, Caustic Potash. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 5-ounce release onto the wooden pallet in a 2’ x 2’ area as a result of improper packing – loose caps. The contractor applied oil dry to the release and used absorbent pads to clean-up the pallet. One 55-gallon DF containing the one leaking jerrican and one 55-gallon DF containing the impacted absorbents and PPE were generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025050414
item.description:
Report E-2025050414

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-26
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0350 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UPO 2. It was reported that approximately 1-liter of an unknown hazmat product released from a cardboard box due to packaging failure. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of UN3265 Ecolab Smartpower Sink & Surface Clean Sanitiz released to the pallet and a 3’x8’ area of the concrete dock due to improper loading. The crew containerized the impacted pallet in a 55-gallon poly drum and wiped up the spilled material The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
